messages: 7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (05:05): badmagic, please don't advocate the use of dev-c++
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (05:12): Why not?
0dd5775810248b267dde1c4ac9270c2a (05:19): nuge: oh that's really going to help you make friends
0dd5775810248b267dde1c4ac9270c2a (05:19): what's wrong with dev-c++?
dafd1ca9f7cf0ac0051d714cb8e40f9a (05:27): i dunno, seems like its a ok editor
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (05:31): dev-c++ is crapola
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (05:31): written in delphi, buggy, slow
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (05:31): code::blocks is far superior
1f703bfc1a3f5148a2387cca68ee1d00 (05:33): lol a C++ IDE written in Delphi
47df498cdcfcfd15933beeb0e306cb7c (05:37): while we are at it, anybody else using emacs for Qt? I'm sure there are gems hidden in some of the .emacs files.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (05:38): I'm using vim; no special highlighting there.
47df498cdcfcfd15933beeb0e306cb7c (05:42): I am so used to it now, I get confused without highlighting, although the default emacs highlighting is a bit too colourful.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:43): ahigerd: :syntax on
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (05:43): I have C++ highlighting
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (05:43): Just no Qt
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:44): for emacs the only think I found to work for Qt were the emacs files in kdesdk
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:45): wiki's back at least
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (05:45): Yay
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:46): I wonder if there's any point in thinking about opening the registration again
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:46): apparently qtcentre has their own wiki now. But it has like one or two articles.
47df498cdcfcfd15933beeb0e306cb7c (05:47): Cool, I will have a look at what's in kdesdk. I have Qt highlighting/identation working so far.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:52): ahigerd: one thing I've been wondering about with Qt on the Mac if you have a sec...
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (05:52): Sure.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:52): you know how there's QApplication::font(), but doesn't the Mac have different fonts for different UI elements?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:52): I've just been curious if Qt uses the different fonts or just uses one font for all.. by default anyway.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:53): Just if you've noticed.. I'm not asking you to go check or anything :)
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:53): (I know each widget can have its own font, but I've just been wondering about what's set by default)
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (05:55): Um... I dunno.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (05:58): It all looks like the same font to me.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (05:58): The same font is used all over iChat and it matches the font used in the menu bar.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (05:59): Safari... looks like the same font, bold, for tabs and bookmarks, otherwise the same.
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (05:59): And that's all I've got loaded right now.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (05:59): hm... lemme see if I can find a link to where it gives some details if you're interested
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (05:59): k
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (06:03): sorry, it's a big honkin' url

d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (06:03): http://developer.apple.com/documentation/UserExperience/Conceptual/OSXHIGuidelines/XHIGText/chapter_13_section_2.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP30000365-TPXREF113
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (06:09): Yep, they're all the same font, just different sizes and weights.
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (06:09): just to make sure... so Qt doesn't folow those guidelines by default?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (06:10): not hard to do it oneself if it's compiled for a mac, but just curious
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (06:10): I'm guessing QApplication::font() defaults to kThemeSystemFont
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (06:10): Or maybe it's kThemeApplicationFont
cdf4ad80dc66a41f951abab3fde0d774 (06:10): I'd have to look
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (06:11): thanks for having checked that out
